00079 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00080 //"sc_io_base"
00081 //
00082 // This inline function returns the type of an i/o stream's base as a SystemC
00083 // base designator.
00084 //   stream_object = reference to the i/o stream whose base is to be returned.
00085 //
00086 //"sc_io_show_base"
00087 //
00088 // This inline function returns true if the base should be shown when a SystemC
00089 // value is displayed via the supplied stream operator.
00090 //   stream_object = reference to the i/o stream to return showbase value for.
00091 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00092 #if defined(__GNUC__) || defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
00093     inline sc_numrep
00094     sc_io_base( ::std::ostream& os, sc_numrep def_base )
00095     {
00096         std::ios::fmtflags flags = os.flags() & std::ios::basefield;
00097         if ( flags & ::std::ios::dec ) return  SC_DEC;
00098         if ( flags & ::std::ios::hex ) return  SC_HEX;
00099         if ( flags & ::std::ios::oct ) return  SC_OCT;
00100         return def_base;
00101     }
00102 
00103     inline bool
00104     sc_io_show_base( ::std::ostream& os )
00105     {
00106         return (os.flags() & ::std::ios::showbase) != 0 ;
00107     }
00108 #else   // Other
00109     inline sc_numrep
00110     sc_io_base( ::std::ostream& /*unused*/, sc_numrep /*unused*/ )
00111     {
00112         return SC_DEC;
00113     }
00114     inline bool
00115     sc_io_show_base( ::std::ostream& /*unused*/ )
00116     {
00117         return false;
00118     }
00119 #endif
00120 
00121 const std::string to_string( sc_numrep );
00122 
00123 inline
00124 ::std::ostream&
00125 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, sc_numrep numrep )
00126 {
00127     os << to_string( numrep );
00128     return os;
00129 }

00164 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00165 //  Naming convention for the vec_ functions below:
00166 //    vec_OP(u, v, w)  : computes w = u OP v.
00167 //    vec_OP_on(u, v)  : computes u = u OP v if u has more digits than v.
00168 //    vec_OP_on2(u, v) : computes u = u OP v if u has fewer digits than v.
00169 //    _large           : parameters are vectors.
00170 //    _small           : one of the parameters is a single digit.
00171 //    Xlen             : the number of digits in X.
00172 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00173

00187

00317 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00318 //  Various utility functions.
00319 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00320 
00321 // Return the low half part of d.
00322 inline
00323 sc_digit
00324 low_half(sc_digit d)
00325 {
00326   return (d & HALF_DIGIT_MASK);
00327 }
00328 
00329 // Return the high half part of d. The high part of the digit may have
00330 // more bits than BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT due to, e.g., overflow in the
00331 // multiplication. Hence, in other functions that use high_half(),
00332 // make sure that the result contains BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT if
00333 // necessary. This is done by high_half_masked().
00334 inline
00335 sc_digit
00336 high_half(sc_digit d)
00337 {
00338   return (d >> BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT);
00339 }
00340 
00341 inline
00342 sc_digit
00343 high_half_masked(sc_digit d)
00344 {
00345   return (high_half(d) & HALF_DIGIT_MASK);
00346 }
00347 
00348 // Concatenate the high part h and low part l. Assumes that h and l
00349 // are less than or equal to HALF_DIGIT_MASK;
00350 inline
00351 sc_digit
00352 concat(sc_digit h, sc_digit l)
00353 {
00354   return ((h << BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT) | l);
00355 }
00356 
00357 // Create a number with n 1's.
00358 inline
00359 sc_digit
00360 one_and_ones(int n)
00361 {
00362   return (((sc_digit) 1 << n) - 1);
00363 }
00364 
00365 // Create a number with one 1 and n 0's.
00366 inline
00367 sc_digit
00368 one_and_zeros(int n)
00369 {
00370   return ((sc_digit) 1 << n);
00371 }
00372

00374 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00375 
00376 // Find the digit that bit i is in.
00377 inline
00378 int
00379 digit_ord(int i)
00380 {
00381   return (i / BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00382 }
00383 
00384 // Find the bit in digit_ord(i) that bit i corressponds to.
00385 inline
00386 int
00387 bit_ord(int i)
00388 {
00389   return (i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00390 }
00391 
00392 
00393 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00394 //  Functions to compare, zero, complement vector(s).
00395 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00396 
00397 // Compare u and v and return r
00398 //  r = 0 if u == v
00399 //  r < 0 if u < v
00400 //  r > 0 if u > v
00401 // - Assume that all the leading zero digits are already skipped.
00402 // - ulen and/or vlen can be zero.
00403 // - Every digit is less than or equal to DIGIT_MASK;
00404 inline
00405 int
00406 vec_cmp(int ulen, const sc_digit *u,
00407         int vlen, const sc_digit *v)
00408 {
00409 
00410 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00411   // sc_assert((ulen <= 0) || (u != NULL));
00412   // sc_assert((vlen <= 0) || (v != NULL));
00413 
00414   // ulen and vlen can be equal to 0 because vec_cmp can be called
00415   // after vec_skip_leading_zeros.
00416   sc_assert((ulen >= 0) && (u != NULL));
00417   sc_assert((vlen >= 0) && (v != NULL));
00418   // If ulen > 0, then the leading digit of u must be non-zero.
00419   sc_assert((ulen <= 0) || (u[ulen - 1] != 0));
00420   sc_assert((vlen <= 0) || (v[vlen - 1] != 0));
00421 #endif
00422 
00423   if (ulen != vlen)
00424     return (ulen - vlen);
00425 
00426   // ulen == vlen >= 1
00427   while ((--ulen >= 0) && (u[ulen] == v[ulen]))
00428     ;
00429 
00430   if (ulen < 0)
00431     return 0;
00432 
00433 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00434   // Test to see if the result is wrong due to the presence of
00435   // overflow bits.
00436   sc_assert((u[ulen] & DIGIT_MASK) != (v[ulen] & DIGIT_MASK));
00437 #endif
00438 
00439   return (int) (u[ulen] - v[ulen]);
00440 
00441 }
00442 
00443 // Find the index of the first non-zero digit.
00444 // - ulen (before) = the number of digits in u.
00445 // - the returned value = the index of the first non-zero digit.
00446 // A negative value of -1 indicates that every digit in u is zero.
00447 inline
00448 int
00449 vec_find_first_nonzero(int ulen, const sc_digit *u)
00450 {
00451 
00452 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00453   // sc_assert((ulen <= 0) || (u != NULL));
00454   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00455 #endif
00456 
00457   while ((--ulen >= 0) && (! u[ulen]))
00458     ;
00459 
00460   return ulen;
00461 
00462 }
00463 
00464 // Skip all the leading zero digits.
00465 // - ulen (before) = the number of digits in u.
00466 // - the returned value = the number of non-zero digits in u.
00467 // - the returned value is non-negative.
00468 inline
00469 int
00470 vec_skip_leading_zeros(int ulen, const sc_digit *u)
00471 {
00472 
00473 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00474   // sc_assert((ulen <= 0) || (u != NULL));
00475   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00476 #endif
00477 
00478   return (1 + vec_find_first_nonzero(ulen, u));
00479 
00480 }
00481 
00482 // Compare u and v and return r
00483 //  r = 0 if u == v
00484 //  r < 0 if u < v
00485 //  r > 0 if u > v
00486 inline
00487 int
00488 vec_skip_and_cmp(int ulen, const sc_digit *u,
00489                  int vlen, const sc_digit *v)
00490 {
00491 
00492 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00493   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00494   sc_assert((vlen > 0) && (v != NULL));
00495 #endif
00496 
00497   ulen = vec_skip_leading_zeros(ulen, u);
00498   vlen = vec_skip_leading_zeros(vlen, v);
00499   // ulen and/or vlen can be equal to zero here.
00500   return vec_cmp(ulen, u, vlen, v);
00501 
00502 }
00503 
00504 // Set u[i] = 0 where i = from ... (ulen - 1).
00505 inline
00506 void
00507 vec_zero(int from, int ulen, sc_digit *u)
00508 {
00509 
00510 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00511   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00512 #endif
00513 
00514   for(int i = from; i < ulen; i++)
00515     u[i] = 0;
00516 
00517 }
00518 
00519 // Set u[i] = 0 where i = 0 .. (ulen - 1).
00520 inline
00521 void
00522 vec_zero(int ulen, sc_digit *u)
00523 {
00524   vec_zero(0, ulen, u);
00525 }
00526 
00527 // Copy n digits from v to u.
00528 inline
00529 void
00530 vec_copy(int n, sc_digit *u, const sc_digit *v)
00531 {
00532 
00533 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00534   sc_assert((n > 0) && (u != NULL) && (v != NULL));
00535 #endif
00536 
00537   for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00538     u[i] = v[i];
00539 }
00540 
00541 // Copy v to u, where ulen >= vlen, and zero the rest of the digits in u.
00542 inline
00543 void
00544 vec_copy_and_zero(int ulen, sc_digit *u,
00545                   int vlen, const sc_digit *v)
00546 {
00547 
00548 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00549   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00550   sc_assert((vlen > 0) && (v != NULL));
00551   sc_assert(ulen >= vlen);
00552 #endif
00553 
00554   vec_copy(vlen, u, v);
00555   vec_zero(vlen, ulen, u);
00556 
00557 }
00558 
00559 // 2's-complement the digits in u.
00560 inline
00561 void
00562 vec_complement(int ulen, sc_digit *u)
00563 {
00564 
00565 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00566   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00567 #endif
00568 
00569   sc_digit carry = 1;
00570 
00571   for (int i = 0; i < ulen; ++i) {
00572     carry += (~u[i] & DIGIT_MASK);
00573     u[i] = carry & DIGIT_MASK;
00574     carry >>= BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00575   }
00576 
00577 }
00578 
00579 
00580 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00581 //  Functions to handle built-in types or signs.
00582 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00583 
00584 // u = v
00585 // - v is an unsigned long or uint64, and positive integer.
00586 template< class Type >
00587 inline
00588 void
00589 from_uint(int ulen, sc_digit *u, Type v)
00590 {
00591 
00592 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00593   // sc_assert((ulen <= 0) || (u != NULL));
00594   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00595   sc_assert(v >= 0);
00596 #endif
00597 
00598   int i = 0;
00599 
00600   while (v && (i < ulen)) {
00601 #ifndef _WIN32
00602     u[i++] = static_cast<sc_digit>( v & DIGIT_MASK );
00603 #else
00604     u[i++] = ((sc_digit) v) & DIGIT_MASK;
00605 #endif
00606     v >>= BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00607   }
00608 
00609   vec_zero(i, ulen, u);
00610 
00611 }
00612 
00613 
00614 // Get u's sign and return its absolute value.
00615 // u can be long, unsigned long, int64, or uint64.
00616 template< class Type >
00617 inline
00618 small_type
00619 get_sign(Type &u)
00620 {
00621   if (u > 0)
00622     return SC_POS;
00623 
00624   if (u == 0)
00625     return SC_ZERO;
00626 
00627   // no positive number representable for minimum value,
00628   // leave as is to avoid Undefined Behaviour
00629   if( SC_LIKELY_( u > (std::numeric_limits<Type>::min)() ) )
00630     u = -u;
00631 
00632   return SC_NEG;
00633 }
00634 
00635 
00636 // Return us * vs:
00637 // - Return SC_ZERO if either sign is SC_ZERO.
00638 // - Return SC_POS if us == vs
00639 // - Return SC_NEG if us != vs.
00640 inline
00641 small_type
00642 mul_signs(small_type us, small_type vs)
00643 {
00644   if ((us == SC_ZERO) || (vs == SC_ZERO))
00645     return SC_ZERO;
00646 
00647   if (us == vs)
00648     return SC_POS;
00649 
00650   return SC_NEG;
00651 }
00652

00654 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00655 //  Functions to test for errors and print out error messages.
00656 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00657 
00658 #ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
00659 
00660 SC_API void test_bound_failed(int nb);
00661 
00662 inline void
00663 test_bound(int nb)
00664 {
00665   if (nb > SC_MAX_NBITS) {
00666     test_bound_failed( nb );
00667     sc_core::sc_abort(); // can't recover from here
00668   }
00669 }
00670 
00671 #endif
00672 
00673 template< class Type >
00674 inline
00675 void
00676 div_by_zero(Type s)
00677 {
00678   if (s == 0) {
00679       SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_OPERATION_FAILED_,
00680                        "div_by_zero<Type>( Type ) : division by zero" );
00681       sc_core::sc_abort(); // can't recover from here
00682   }
00683 }
00684 
00685 
00686 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00687 //  Functions to check if a given vector is zero or make one.
00688 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00689 
00690 // If u[i] is zero for every i = 0,..., ulen - 1, return SC_ZERO,
00691 // else return s.
00692 inline
00693 small_type
00694 check_for_zero(small_type s, int ulen, const sc_digit *u)
00695 {
00696 
00697 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00698   // sc_assert(ulen >= 0);
00699   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00700 #endif
00701 
00702   if (vec_find_first_nonzero(ulen, u) < 0)
00703     return SC_ZERO;
00704 
00705   return s;
00706 
00707 }
00708 
00709 // If u[i] is zero for every i = 0,..., ulen - 1, return true,
00710 // else return false.
00711 inline
00712 bool
00713 check_for_zero(int ulen, const sc_digit *u)
00714 {
00715 
00716 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00717   // sc_assert(ulen >= 0);
00718   sc_assert((ulen > 0) && (u != NULL));
00719 #endif
00720 
00721   if (vec_find_first_nonzero(ulen, u) < 0)
00722     return true;
00723 
00724   return false;
00725 
00726 }
00727 
00728 inline
00729 small_type
00730 make_zero(int nd, sc_digit *d)
00731 {
00732   vec_zero(nd, d);
00733   return SC_ZERO;
00734 }
00735 
00736 
00737 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00738 //  Functions for both signed and unsigned numbers to convert sign-magnitude
00739 //  (SM) and 2's complement (2C) representations.
00740 //  added = 1 => for signed.
00741 //  added = 0 => for unsigned.
00742 //  IF_SC_SIGNED can be used as 'added'.
00743 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00744 
00745 // Trim the extra leading bits of a signed or unsigned number.
00746 inline
00747 void
00748 trim(small_type added, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00749 {
00750 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00751   sc_assert((nb > 0) && (nd > 0) && (d != NULL));
00752 #endif
00753 
00754   d[nd - 1] &= one_and_ones(bit_ord(nb - 1) + added);
00755 }
00756 
00757 // Convert an (un)signed number from sign-magnitude representation to
00758 // 2's complement representation and trim the extra bits.
00759 inline
00760 void
00761 convert_SM_to_2C_trimmed(small_type added,
00762                          small_type s, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00763 {
00764   if (s == SC_NEG) {
00765     vec_complement(nd, d);
00766     trim(added, nb, nd, d);
00767   }
00768 }
00769 
00770 // Convert an (un)signed number from sign-magnitude representation to
00771 // 2's complement representation but do not trim the extra bits.
00772 inline
00773 void
00774 convert_SM_to_2C(small_type s, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00775 {
00776   if (s == SC_NEG)
00777     vec_complement(nd, d);
00778 }
00779 
00780 
00781 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00782 //  Functions to convert between sign-magnitude (SM) and 2's complement
00783 //  (2C) representations of signed numbers.
00784 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00785 
00786 // Trim the extra leading bits off a signed number.
00787 inline
00788 void
00789 trim_signed(int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00790 {
00791 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00792   sc_assert((nb > 0) && (nd > 0) && (d != NULL));
00793 #endif
00794 
00795   d[nd - 1] &= one_and_ones(bit_ord(nb - 1) + 1);
00796 }
00797 
00798 // Convert a signed number from 2's complement representation to
00799 // sign-magnitude representation, and return its sign. nd is d's
00800 // actual size, without zeros eliminated.
00801 inline
00802 small_type
00803 convert_signed_2C_to_SM(int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00804 {
00805 
00806 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00807   sc_assert((nb > 0) && (nd > 0) && (d != NULL));
00808 #endif
00809 
00810   small_type s;
00811 
00812   int xnb = bit_ord(nb - 1) + 1;
00813 
00814   // Test the sign bit.
00815   if (d[nd - 1] & one_and_zeros(xnb - 1)) {
00816     s = SC_NEG;
00817     vec_complement(nd, d);
00818   }
00819   else
00820     s = SC_POS;
00821 
00822   // Trim the last digit.
00823   d[nd - 1] &= one_and_ones(xnb);
00824 
00825   // Check if the new number is zero.
00826   if (s == SC_POS)
00827     return check_for_zero(s, nd, d);
00828 
00829   return s;
00830 
00831 }
00832 
00833 // Convert a signed number from sign-magnitude representation to 2's
00834 // complement representation, get its sign, convert back to
00835 // sign-magnitude representation, and return its sign. nd is d's
00836 // actual size, without zeros eliminated.
00837 inline
00838 small_type
00839 convert_signed_SM_to_2C_to_SM(small_type s, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00840 {
00841   convert_SM_to_2C(s, nd, d);
00842   return convert_signed_2C_to_SM(nb, nd, d);
00843 }
00844 
00845 // Convert a signed number from sign-magnitude representation to 2's
00846 // complement representation and trim the extra bits.
00847 inline
00848 void
00849 convert_signed_SM_to_2C_trimmed(small_type s, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00850 {
00851   convert_SM_to_2C_trimmed(1, s, nb, nd, d);
00852 }
00853 
00854 // Convert a signed number from sign-magnitude representation to 2's
00855 // complement representation but do not trim the extra bits.
00856 inline
00857 void
00858 convert_signed_SM_to_2C(small_type s, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00859 {
00860   convert_SM_to_2C(s, nd, d);
00861 }
00862 
00863 
00864 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00865 //  Functions to convert between sign-magnitude (SM) and 2's complement
00866 //  (2C) representations of unsigned numbers.
00867 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00868 
00869 // Trim the extra leading bits off an unsigned number.
00870 inline
00871 void
00872 trim_unsigned(int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00873 {
00874 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00875   sc_assert((nb > 0) && (nd > 0) && (d != NULL));
00876 #endif
00877 
00878   d[nd - 1] &= one_and_ones(bit_ord(nb - 1));
00879 }
00880 
00881 // Convert an unsigned number from 2's complement representation to
00882 // sign-magnitude representation, and return its sign. nd is d's
00883 // actual size, without zeros eliminated.
00884 inline
00885 small_type
00886 convert_unsigned_2C_to_SM(int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00887 {
00888   trim_unsigned(nb, nd, d);
00889   return check_for_zero(SC_POS, nd, d);
00890 }
00891 
00892 // Convert an unsigned number from sign-magnitude representation to
00893 // 2's complement representation, get its sign, convert back to
00894 // sign-magnitude representation, and return its sign. nd is d's
00895 // actual size, without zeros eliminated.
00896 inline
00897 small_type
00898 convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C_to_SM(small_type s, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00899 {
00900   convert_SM_to_2C(s, nd, d);
00901   return convert_unsigned_2C_to_SM(nb, nd, d);
00902 }
00903 
00904 // Convert an unsigned number from sign-magnitude representation to
00905 // 2's complement representation and trim the extra bits.
00906 inline
00907 void
00908 convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C_trimmed(small_type s, int nb, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00909 {
00910   convert_SM_to_2C_trimmed(0, s, nb, nd, d);
00911 }
00912 
00913 // Convert an unsigned number from sign-magnitude representation to
00914 // 2's complement representation but do not trim the extra bits.
00915 inline
00916 void
00917 convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C(small_type s, int nd, sc_digit *d)
00918 {
00919   convert_SM_to_2C(s, nd, d);
00920 }
00921 
00922 
00923 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00924 //  Functions to copy one (un)signed number to another.
00925 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00926 
00927 // Copy v to u.
00928 inline
00929 void
00930 copy_digits_signed(small_type &us,
00931                    int unb, int und, sc_digit *ud,
00932                    int vnb, int vnd, const sc_digit *vd)
00933 {
00934 
00935   if (und <= vnd) {
00936 
00937     vec_copy(und, ud, vd);
00938 
00939     if (unb <= vnb)
00940       us = convert_signed_SM_to_2C_to_SM(us, unb, und, ud);
00941 
00942   }
00943   else // und > vnd
00944     vec_copy_and_zero(und, ud, vnd, vd);
00945 
00946 }
00947 
00948 // Copy v to u.
00949 inline
00950 void
00951 copy_digits_unsigned(small_type &us,
00952                      int unb, int und, sc_digit *ud,
00953                      int /* vnb */, int vnd, const sc_digit *vd)
00954 {
00955 
00956   if (und <= vnd)
00957     vec_copy(und, ud, vd);
00958 
00959   else // und > vnd
00960     vec_copy_and_zero(und, ud, vnd, vd);
00961 
00962   us = convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C_to_SM(us, unb, und, ud);
00963 
00964 }
00965 
00966 
00967 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00968 //  Faster set(i, v), without bound checking.
00969 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00970 
00971 // A version of set(i, v) without bound checking.
00972 inline
00973 void
00974 safe_set(int i, bool v, sc_digit *d)
00975 {
00976 
00977 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00978   sc_assert((i >= 0) && (d != NULL));
00979 #endif
00980 
00981   int bit_num = bit_ord(i);
00982   int digit_num = digit_ord(i);
00983 
00984   if (v)
00985     d[digit_num] |= one_and_zeros(bit_num);
00986   else
00987     d[digit_num] &= ~(one_and_zeros(bit_num));
00988 
00989 }
00990 
00991 
00992 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00993 //  Function to check if a double number is bad (NaN or infinite).
00994 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00995 
00996 inline
00997 bool
00998 is_nan( double v )
00999 {
01000     return std::numeric_limits<double>::has_quiet_NaN && (v != v);
01001 }
01002 
01003 inline
01004 bool
01005 is_inf( double v )
01006 {
01007     return v ==  std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
01008         || v == -std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity();
01009 }
01010 
01011 inline
01012 void
01013 is_bad_double(double v)
01014 {
01015 // Windows throws exception.
01016     if( is_nan(v) || is_inf(v) )
01017         SC_REPORT_ERROR( sc_core::SC_ID_VALUE_NOT_VALID_,
01018                          "is_bad_double( double v ) : "
01019                          "v is not finite - NaN or Inf" );
01020 }
01021 
01022 } // namespace sc_dt

01024 
01025 #endif
